sources.title: Inside The Lines (1930) [Colorized, 4K, 60FPS]
sources.description: Inside The Lines is a 1930 black and white movie film which has been colorised, upscaled to 4K, and frames per second boosted to 60 FPS in 2021 using Artificial Intelligence (A.I) and Google Colab @  https://colab.research.google.com   Technologies used: A.I. Colorizing:  https://github.com/jantic/DeOldify  A.I. Increasing frame rate 60 FPS:  https://rife-vfi.github.io   A.I. Upscaling to 4K:  https://ffmpeg.org   GPU: Google Colab. This movie is in public domain category and it is Copyright free.

sources.title: Inside The Lines (1930)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Betty Compson leads this film as a spy for the German government during World War I. Her mission is to infiltrate the British territory of Gibraltar to sabotage the British fleet. Compson's performance in the film has been praised, but the plot has a couple twists that don't always work in its favor.  I've uploaded two versions of this film, one with superior sound quality, but which cuts out all title and ending cards and location cards. The other has certain scenes that are indecipherable due to the poor audio preservation.

sources.title: Inside the Lines (1930) WWI DRAMA
sources.description:
tars: Betty Compson, Ralph Forbes, Montagu Love
Director: Roy Pomeroy

During WWI, German spies will stop at nothing to spy on the allied war plans stored at Gibraltar.
